column4: I'm having major issues installing Ubuntu Server x64 on my pc
i keep going through a Debootstrap warning
Are you trying to install actual 64bit version of Ubuntu or just the normal version on a 64bit processor?
If at all possible I would recommend the 32bit version.
Are you planning on giving the virtual machine more than 4GB of memory?
Even if you do are you planning on running a single process that needs more than 2GB of memory?
Ill download it now, but what do I do about this version that won't work
Sorry I got kicked off.  Did you respond?
Didn't VirtualBox just add 64bit support?  Are you running that version?
I'd double check that.  If so I have not idea.  I just know the 32bit will work MUCH better in a lot of respects.  Linux is better than Windows with 64bit but the world is just not ready.
It will use less memory too since 32bit code is smaller than 64bit
I always do.  Makes it easier to try everything out.
So far so good.   Thanks for your help!
That didn't work
Where did it stop this time?
I'd try it myself but I'm running on a tin can and a few light bulbs for memory right now so I can't.
Thats fine.  I could have made a copy of x64 again
Are you running virtualbox?
I run it normally but right now I've had a driver failure and I'm running off a hacked live USB on an old machine.
Drive failure rather.
Do you remember what your "General Settings" were?
Sorry...been a while since I looked
Thats fine... Thanks for your help
